ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Kunark Expansion
ygData.msgSnippet: Stop worrying.  SPDAT.EFF is a farcical file at best.  As a matter of fact GZ posted a bunch of false data in it _on purpose_ because they don t want people
ygData.messageBody:
Stop worrying. SPDAT.EFF is a farcical file at best. As a matter of fact
GZ posted a bunch of false data in it _on purpose_ because they don't want
people knowing what's going in for Kunark.

The stuff going in for test is for testing. I seriously doubt half of
what's listed goes into final.

Besides. I hate that people are even trying to figure this out already.
All you guys are doing is getting really worked up over something that may
or may not happen.

Sheesh folks, it's a GAME, give me a break. Yeah I'm miffed that we're
missing 3 songs still. Sure that irks me. Do I care? Not really, it
doesn't make me any 'weaker' as a Bard. Will I be upset if they don't add
songs? Yeah, but why should I borrow trouble that doesn't even exist yet?

Getting all worked up 6 weeks before the product comes out based on
information that isn't even *real* is silly.

Lyrnia Jongleur
Bard of Norrath
----- Original Message -----
From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, March 14, 2000 2:15 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Kunark Expansion


> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
>
> Expected? No. Hoped? Yes.
>
> Given the number of spells we didn't have yet at release, it also would
not
> surprise me if they didn't have any spells ready for our new levels when
> they released the expansion.
>
> The info comes from the spdat file. This is the same file used to try and
> parse out what spells do based on the data therein.
>
> I am concerned that this is only more evidence that bards are still a
class
> that Verant does not care about one iota. I doubt I will ever make it to
> the levels required for the new spells, but I am sure many on this list
> will.
>
> Kit
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Daniel P. Sniderman [mailto:fuzzbone@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, March 14, 2000 12:13 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Kunark Expansion
>
>
> From: "Daniel P. Sniderman" <fuzzbone@...>
>
> I'm not concerned. The question is - where is this information coming
from?
> Verant hasn't released anything officially. AFIK the info is coming from
> what people are finding on the test server (both on the server and files
> that are downloaded).
>
> The conclusion I draw from this is not - that we aren't getting any - but
> that ours will be tested less. Do you expect anything different?
>
> Slyde
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
> To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, March 14, 2000 12:52 PM
> Subject: [eqbards] Kunark Expansion
>
>
> > From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
> >
> > I have been eagerly looking over the lists of test server spells on
> Caster's
> > Realm and have noticed one disturbing fact. There are no new bard
spells
> > listed, not even for our currently missing levels. Every other class
has
> at
> > least 15 spells. With the expansion now less than a month away
shouldn't
> > there be some new bard spells if they have any intention of getting them
> in
> > for the expansion release?
> >
> > Kit
